If the transformation \\(T_{\\lambda}[z](t)\\) is applied to the initial state \\(z_0\\) at t = 0, then allowed to progress under the equation \\(z(t) = Ce^{i \\omega t}z_0\\) without further intervention, will the value of \\(z(T)\\) at T = T be the same as if \\(z_0\\) was directly evolved to T under \\(z(t) = Ce^{i \\omega t}z_0\\)?
Explanation: Applying \\(T_{\\lambda}[z](t)\\) modifies the initial conditions by integrating with a decay factor, thus altering the signal's trajectory and its final state at T, making \\(z(T)\\) different from direct evolution of \\(z_0\\) under \\(z(t)\\).
